definition: A set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened together along one side and encased between protective covers.
A form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement.
Websites and applications that enable users to create and share content or to participate in social networking.
The art or science of combining vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.

All forms of competitive physical activity or games which, through casual or organised participation, aim to use, maintain or improve physical ability and skills while providing enjoyment to participants.
The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.
Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth.
The movement of people between distant geographical locations, either for leisure or for work.
The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.
The study of past events, particularly in human affairs.

The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form such as painting or sculpture, producing works to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power.
Multicellular, eukaryotic organisms of the kingdom Animalia (also called Metazoa).
Activities done regularly in one's leisure time for pleasure.
A popular trend, especially in styles of dress and ornament or manners of behavior.
The process of receiving or giving systematic instruction, especially at a school or university.
The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.
The state of being free from illness or injury.
Newly received or noteworthy information, especially about recent events.
A form of play or sport, especially a competitive one played according to rules and decided by skill, strength, or luck.
The arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively.
A continuous area or expanse that is free, available, or unoccupied.
A series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person's mind during sleep.
Professional entertainment consisting of jokes and satirical sketches, intended to make an audience laugh.
The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way.
A day or period of celebration, typically for religious reasons.
A humorous image, video, piece of text, etc., that is copied (often with slight variations) and spread rapidly by Internet users.
The phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features and products of the earth, as opposed to humans or human creations.
The art or practice of taking and processing photographs.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence, especially when considered as an academic discipline.
Literary work in which special intensity is given to the expression of feelings and ideas by the use of distinctive style and rhythm; poems collectively or as a genre of literature.
The way in which two or more concepts, objects, or people are connected, or the state of being connected.
The computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment.
The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
The state of a country or region in terms of the production and consumption of goods and services and the supply of money.
A traditional story, especially one concerning the early history of a people or explaining some natural or social phenomenon, and typically involving supernatural beings or events.
The practice or skill of preparing food by combining, mixing, and heating ingredients.
The practice of thinking deeply or focusing one's mind for a period of time, in silence or with the aid of chanting, for religious or spiritual purposes or as a method of relaxation.
The condition of being physically fit and healthy.
The activity of tending and cultivating a garden, especially as a pastime.
The art or practice of designing and constructing buildings.
A building or outdoor area in which plays and other dramatic performances are given.
The action of leading a group of people or an organization.

A digital audio file made available on the Internet for downloading to a computer or mobile device, typically available as a series, new installments of which can be received by subscribers automatically.
The action of inventing something, typically a process or device.
An account of someone's life written by someone else.
The study of the movements and relative positions of celestial bodies interpreted as having an influence on human affairs and the natural world.
An unusual and exciting, typically hazardous, experience or activity.
Denoting events or phenomena such as telekinesis or clairvoyance that are beyond the scope of normal scientific understanding.
The branch of science which deals with celestial objects, space, and the physical universe as a whole.
The scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behavior in a given context.
The traditional beliefs, customs, and stories of a community, passed through the generations by word of mouth.
The plants, animals, and other organisms that live in the ocean.
The branch of technology that deals with the design, construction, operation, and application of robots.
The process of designing and building an executable computer program to accomplish a specific computing result or to perform a particular task.
The action or process of innovating; a new method, idea, product, etc.
A famous person, especially in entertainment or sports.
The activities associated with the governance of a country or other area, especially the debate between parties having power.

A change in global or regional climate patterns, in particular a change apparent from the mid to late 20th century onwards and attributed largely to the increased levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide produced by the use of fossil fuels.
The act or process of making speeches in public.
The objectives or milestones individuals aim to achieve in their professional lives.
Something that a particular person finds especially annoying.
Moral principles that govern a person's behavior or the conducting of an activity.
The study of objects of art considered within their time period.
The power of apparently influencing the course of events by using mysterious or supernatural forces.
The process of being mentally stimulated to do or feel something, especially to do something creative.
